009package Ch09_AutomaticThresholding;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.addToDialog;
012import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.getFromDialog;
013
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
016import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
017import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive.AdaptiveThresholder;
020import imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive.BernsenThresholder;
021import imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive.BernsenThresholder.Parameters;
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * ImageJ plugin showing the use of the {@link BernsenThresholder} class
026 * (see Sec. 9.2.1 of [1] for additional details).
027 * This plugin works on 8-bit grayscale images only. The original image
028 * is modified to a binary image.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
032 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/04/01
037 * @see imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive.BernsenThresholder
038 */
039public class Adaptive_Bernsen implements PlugInFilter {
040        
041        private static Parameters params = new Parameters();
042        
043        @Override
044        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
045                return DOES_8G;
046        }
047
048        @Override
049        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
050                if (!runDialog(params))
051                        return;
052                
053                ByteProcessor I = (ByteProcessor) ip;   
054                AdaptiveThresholder thr = new BernsenThresholder(params);
055                ByteProcessor Q = thr.getThreshold(I);
056                thr.threshold(I, Q);
057        }
058        
059        boolean runDialog(Parameters params) {
060                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
061                addToDialog(params, gd);
062                
063                gd.showDialog();
064                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
065                        return false;
066                }       
067                
068                getFromDialog(params, gd);
069                return true;
070        }
071}
